definition: lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands

sentences.english: Many spurious claims are made and millions are lost annually on bogus news.
sentences.chinese: 许多伪称是由千千万万的人正在失去每年假消息。

sentences.english: Hundreds of thousands of homes and businesses are in the dark and flights are being cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 千千万万栋房屋和商业楼处于黑暗中，航班也被取消。

sentences.english: Many many years later, not much has changed.
sentences.chinese: 千千万万年以后，没有多大的变化。

sentences.english: By then, hundreds of thousands of people in Europe and America to drive home the road reunion.
sentences.chinese: 届时，千千万万的欧美人风尘仆仆地赶回家中团聚。

definition: lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
hundreds/a large number/lit. by the hundreds and thousands
every living being (Buddhism)/the mass of common people
to advance dauntlessly in wave upon wave (idiom)
one falls, the next follows (idiom); stepping into the breach to replace fallen comrades/advancing wave upon wave
lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
to feel as if it had happened to oneself/to sympathize/(polite expression of gratitude for a favor received by a friend etc) I take it as a personal favor
